body:
Avoid UB (member call on nullptr) when failing to read randomness in the startup process.

`RandFailure` is called by `GetDevURandom`, `GetOSRand` and `GetRandBytes` when failing to read randomness for some reason.

This is `RandFailure`:

```
[[noreturn]] static void RandFailure()
{
    LogPrintf("Failed to read randomness, aborting\n");
    std::abort();
}
```

This is `LogPrintf`:

```
template <typename... Args>
static inline void LogPrintf(const char* fmt, const Args&... args)
{
    if (g_logger->Enabled()) {
        Ã¢ÂÂ¦
    }
}
```

`g_logger` is `nullptr` before the logging is properly setup. 

Compilers are allowed to optimise away calls to `RandFailure` that are guaranteed to take place before the logging is properly setup (until `g_logger != nullptr`). Please note that such optimisation would remove the crucial `std::abort` call in `RandFailure`.

Failing to read randomness before this patch (under UBSan):

```
$ src/bitcoind
logging.h:135:19: runtime error: member call on null pointer of type 'BCLog::Logger'
<undefined behaviour>
```

Failing to read randomness after this patch (under UBSan):

```
$ src/bitcoind
Failed to read randomness, aborting
$
```
title: Avoid UB (member call on nullptr) when failing to read randomness in the startup process
